intro: Hieracium hamadanense, commonly known as the Hamadan hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Iran. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy, with a height ranging from 10 to 30 centimeters. The flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, contributing to its ornamental appeal.
